description:
It all starts when Gokudou steals a pouch from a fortuneteller, thinking that it contains a gem. Instead, it turns out to be a rock, from which emerges Djinn. The genie grants Gokudou the standard three wishes, but our anti-hero doesn't think heavily about his wishes. Gokudou does get his wishes, though not exactly in the fashion that he expected. The best thing he gets out of his wishes is Honou no Maken, a magical sword that enables its owner to do fire attacks and it can be summoned from anywhere in the world.

Even with an enchanted sword, Gokudou doesn't get much respect. He gets turned into a woman by Djinn, who is also a shapeshifter. He is followed by Rubette La Late, a potential love interest who is more interested in adventure, karaoke and outperforming Gokudou. He gets whapped on the head a lot, especially by the fortuneteller who reappears throughout the series just to plague Gokudou it seems. Later in the series, he gets another sidekick, a former evil magician named Prince, who is more handsome and a better womanizer than Gokudou.

(Source: AnimeNfo)

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

tags.name: Body Swapping
tags.description: Centers around individuals swapping bodies with one another.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Age Regression
tags.description: Prominently features a character who was returned to a younger state.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

node.description: He is a professional screenwriter for anime, drama and theater and is a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/下笠美穂)

Noted for her work as an animation director on the [Sailor Moon](https://anilist.co/anime/530/) series.

Married to [Akihiko Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/103299/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/下笠美穂)

Noted for her work as an animation director on the [Sailor Moon](https://anilist.co/anime/530/) series.

Married to [Akihiko Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/103299/).

Among [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/)'s most noted directors.

Famous directorial works include [Planetes](https://anilist.co/anime/329/), [Scryed](https://anilist.co/anime/168/), [Infinite Ryvius](https://anilist.co/anime/593/) as well as [Code Geass](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/), which is an original story created by him and the series' lead writer [Ichirou Ookouchi](https://anilist.co/staff/98067/). Taniguchi is the one who proposed the idea to the producers at Sunrise. The basic idea for the plot consisted of a "hero" who led a secret organization, which was later developed into a conflict between two characters with different values and who belonged to the same military unit.

Ilustrator and Director specialized in OPs and Game Cutscenes. 

His work stands out for the vibrant color schemes, prominent character animation and tendency to interlace different portions of the screen.

**Notable works outside anime:**

- Shin Megami Tensei: Persona 3 (Videogame, 2006) (OP Director, Animation Cutscene Director, Animation Director)
- Shin Megami Tensei: Persona 3 - Portable (Videogame, 2009) (OP Director, OP Animation Director, OP Editing)

Fujino Sadayoshi is a sound director working for Cruise. He has mostly worked on anime shows produced by Sunrise and Nippon Animation. He was married to actress and voice actress [Fujii Kayoko](https://anilist.co/staff/105105/Kayoko-Fujii).

Among [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/)'s most noted directors.

Famous directorial works include [Planetes](https://anilist.co/anime/329/), [Scryed](https://anilist.co/anime/168/), [Infinite Ryvius](https://anilist.co/anime/593/) as well as [Code Geass](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/), which is an original story created by him and the series' lead writer [Ichirou Ookouchi](https://anilist.co/staff/98067/). Taniguchi is the one who proposed the idea to the producers at Sunrise. The basic idea for the plot consisted of a "hero" who led a secret organization, which was later developed into a conflict between two characters with different values and who belonged to the same military unit.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/下笠美穂)

Noted for her work as an animation director on the [Sailor Moon](https://anilist.co/anime/530/) series.

Married to [Akihiko Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/103299/).
